Legal disclaimer
The contents of these pages were prepared with utmost care. Nonetheless, we cannot assume liability for the timeless accuracy and completeness of the information.
Our website contains links to external websites. As the contents of these third-party websites are beyond our control, we cannot accept liability for them. Responsibility for the contents of the linked pages is always held by the provider or operator of the pages.

Data protection
In general, when visiting the website of innertiming.eu, no personal data are saved. However, these data can be given on a voluntary basis. No data will be passed on to third parties without your consent. We point out that in regard to unsecured data transmission in the internet (e.g. via email), security cannot be guaranteed. Such data could possibly be accessed by third parties.
tc_text: By clicking on “Agree and start”, you agree to take part in this study. You can withdraw from the study at any time. No data will be stored that can identify you. However, you will be asked to answer some general questions about yourself that will be aggregated and analysed together with the data of many other participants. In case you are unsure about the study, please contact us at slomo@uni-hamburg.de (ERC-Project SloMo, University of Hamburg, Germany).
welcome_title:
How good is your
inner timing? Test it!
welcome_text: Thank you for your interest in this study! As part of a research project, we are investigating how well people can tap without influences such as music. Your task is to tap evenly on your device for %d seconds. Afterwards, you will get feedback about your performance. Additionally, we would like you to answer a few simple questions.
welcome_lead:
It only takes about 2-3 minutes.

For other languages click one of the flags in the top right corner.
prequestions_q0: Did you partake in this study before?
prequestions_q3: In which country have you spent most of your life?
prequestions_q4: How large is the population of the area you currently live in?
prequestions_warning: Please answer all the questions above to continue.
experiment_p1: Your task is now to tap steadily for %d seconds.
experiment_p2: Try to keep the time between each tap as even as possible. Choose a pace that feels most comfortable and natural to you right now.
experiment_p3: When using a touchscreen display, please use your finger to tap in the circle that will appear below. If you use a computer, you can use any key on your keyboard or use the mouse to click into the circle. Please click "Start" when you are ready. The experiment timer will then start running with your first tap.
feedback_fail_message:
Sorry, but your taps were either not even enough or too few.
Remember, try to pace taps evenly at your most comfortable rate for as long as indicated by the timer.
Please try again!
feedback_success_message:
Very good! Your taps were even!
Please click 'Continue', we have a few more questions for you.
feedback_too_short: You need to tap as long as the timer is running, please try again.
postquestions_q2: How do you feel right now?
postquestions_q3: How many hours do you spend studying/working in a typical week?
postquestions_q4: In the last month, how often have you felt that you were unable to control the important things in your life?
postquestions_q5: In the last month, how often have you felt confident about your ability to handle your personal problems?
postquestions_q6: In the last month, how often have you felt that things were going your way?
postquestions_q7: In the last month, how often have you felt difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them?
postquestions_p1: The following questions are about your feelings and thoughts during the last month. You will be asked to indicate how often you felt or thought a certain way. They may explain your inner timing.
finish_p1_a:
Thank you for participation!
We would very much appreciate if you could share this test via social media to make more people aware of it:
finish_p1_b: If you are interested in the results of the study you can leave us your e-mail address here.
finish_submit_success: Thank you! Your email address was submitted.
finish_submit_fail: You have to enter a valid email address.
finish_p2: If you are interested in the general research project click here:
